Blog.post: urlLink well... here's Gumby the flower boy. this particular picture has really not much to do with me, with the exception of the fact that i really like Monty Python Flying Circus. funny series that, no? a well, back to work

urlLink i tried to stop smoking, but it wont work for me. i am down to 3-4 cigs a day, but i'm way too absent-minded to quit completely yet. oh yeah, btw, this is the car i was talking about. i jacked the picture off autotrader and put awful effect on it, but now you know what im talking about. chevrolet forever! eh? did i say it out loud? i meant forever in hell :P
i just figured world out. i think. no, wait, its gone again. bleedin' conspiracy, i tell ya
yay my car is functional once again. it cost me a bit of a buck, but heck, at least i get from point A to point B.
my car dead. alternator died on it and since it is a pain in the buttocks (thanks, chevrolet! z34 is soooooooo easy to work on. yeah right), i could not fix it myself. sniff... o.O
urlLink nah, thats me. no, really.

alas, poor yorick! i am still not sure why i joined this monstrosity, the blogger. i wonder if the creator of this doomsday instrument ever could predict the vast number of addicts that this device has now... horrible, horrible creation. and yet, genial. i knew him, horatio - a fellow of infinite jest, of most excellent fancy. the world will end. sooner or later. no, seriously, it will end and we will all realize the failure of our own experiment. i dont think it will be all-powerful fella (who some refer to as "God"), or asteroid or global warming that will destroy this planet. eventually, someone will create a big bomb enough to vaporize half of the earth, and some other fella will come in, not believe the power of the bomb, and activate it. as my favourite writer, Terry Pratchett says: " If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying ' End-of-the World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH ,' the paint wouldn't even have time to dry . he hath bore me on his back a thousand times, and how now abhorred in my imagination it is. well, thats all folks for now.
well. i havent been online for ages - a tad of lightning around here. bleh. one of my friends lost both his router and firewall, which were literally smoking. no tornadoes though. yet.
